subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Although He was a Son, he learned obedience from what He suffered. (Hebrews 5:8) NIV
reflection: Jesus' human life was not a script that He passively followed. It was a life He chose freely (John 10:17, 18). It was a continuous process of making the will of God the Father His own. Jesus chose to obey, even though obedience led to suffering and death. Because Jesus obeyed perfectly, even under great trial, He can help us obey, no matter how difficult obedience seems to be.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, guide and direct me in thy will. I pray that through obedience my life would be an example of You living within me. Protect our troops today I pray. Help them recognize those who wish to do them harm. Be with those who are innocently caught in the middle of this war. I pray for the day that peace will reign eternal. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Save for retirement starting with your first paycheck...

Our Meditation for Today:

Although He was a Son, he learned obedience from
what He suffered...(Heb. 5:8) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus' human life was not a script that He passively followed.
It was a life He chose freely (Jn. 10:17, 18)...

It was a continuous process of making the will of God the Father
His own. Jesus chose to obey, even though obedience led to
suffering and death...

Because Jesus obeyed perfectly, even under great trial, He can 
help us obey, no matter how difficult obedience seems to be...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, guide and direct me in thy will...
I pray that through obedience my life would be an example
of You living with-in me...Protect our troops today I pray...
Help them recognize those who wish to do them harm...
Be with those who are innocently caught in the middle of this
war...I pray for the day that peace will reign eternal...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Once made perfect, He became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey Him. (Hebrews 5:9) NIV
reflection: Christ was always morally perfect. By obeying, He demonstrated His perfection to us, not to God or Himself. In the Bible, perfect usually means completeness or maturity. By sharing our experience of suffering, Christ shared our human experience completely. He is now able to offer eternal salvation to those who obey Him. See Philippians 2:5-11 for Christ's attitude as He took on human form.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray today for a Christ-like attitude in all that I do, guide and direct my every thought. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~When it comes to chocolate, resistance is futile...

Our Meditation for Today:

Once made perfect, He became the source of eternal salvation
for all who obey Him...(Heb. 5:9) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Christ was always morally perfect. By obeying, He demonstrated
His perfection to us, not to God or Himself...

In the Bible, perfect usually means completeness or maturity...

By sharing our experience of suffering, Christ shared our human
experience completely. He is now able to offer eternal salvation to 
those who obey Him...

See Phil. 2:5-11 for Christ's attitude as He took on human form...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray today for a Christ-like
attitude in all that I do, guide and direct my every 
thought...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

By sharing our experience of suffering, Christ shared our human experience completely. He is now able to offer eternal salvation to those who obey Him. subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We have much to say about this, but it is hard to explain because you are slow to learn. In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God's Word all over again. You need milk, not solid food! Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness...(Hebrews 5:11-13) NIV
reflection: What Paul was saying here is that these Jewish Christians were immature. Paul says that by this time they should have been teaching others, but they had not applied the basics to their own lives. They were reluctant to move beyond their old traditions, their established doctrines, and discussions of the basics. Paul is saying they wouldn't be able to understand the high-priestly role of Christ unless they moved out of their comfort zone. They would have to cut some of their Jewish ties, and stop trying to blend in with their culture. If we are truly committed to Christ He will move us out of our comfort zone.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for a greater maturity of my faith in You. Help me to move into a life totally committed to You. Help me to apply all that I learn so that I may be of greater use to You. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~It's OK to let your children see you cry~~~

Our Meditation for Today: (warning against falling away)

We have much to say about this, but it is hard to explain because
you are slow to learn...

In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God's Word all over again.
You need milk, not solid food!

Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with 
the teaching about righteousness...(Heb. 5:11-13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

What Paul was saying here is that these Jewish Christians were immature.
Paul says that by this time they should have been teaching others, but they
had not applied the basics to their own lives...

They were reluctant to move beyond their old traditions, their established
doctrines, and discussions of the basics..

Paul is saying they wouldn't be able to understand the high-priestly role of
Christ unless they moved out of their comfort zone. They would have to cut
some of their Jewish ties, and stop trying to blend in with their culture...

If we are truly committed to Christ He will move us out of our comfort zone...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for a greater maturity of my faith in You...
Help me to move into a life totally committed to You...
Help me to apply all that I learn so that I may be of greater use to You...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness. But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil. (Hebrews 5:13, 14) NIV
reflection: In order to become mature Christians we need to learn discernment. We must train our conscience, our senses, our mind, and our body to distinguish good from evil. Are you able to recognize temptation before it traps you? Can you tell the difference between a correct use of Scripture and a mistaken use? Our ability understand the deeper knowledge of God, is the determining factor in our spiritual growth. To often we want God's banquet before we are spiritually capable of digesting it. As you grow in the Lord and put into practice what you have learned, your capacity to understand will also grow.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word I pray that I would continue to grow in wisdom so that I may truly feast on Your Word. Instill in me a greater love for You and Your Word. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Don't compare your life to others. You have no idea 
what their journey is all about...

Our Meditation for Today:

Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not 
acquainted with the teaching about righteousness.

But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have 
trained themselves to distinguish good from evil...(Heb. 5:13, 14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

In order to become mature Christians we need to learn discernment.
We must train our conscience, our senses, our mind, and our body 
to distinguish good from evil...

Are you able to recognize temptation before it traps you?

Can you tell the difference between a correct use of Scripture and 
a mistaken use?

Our ability understand the deeper knowledge of God, is the determining
factor in our spiritual growth...

To often we want God's banquet before we are spiritually capable of digesting it...

As you grow in the Lord and put into practice what you have learned, your
capacity to understand will also grow...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word
I pray that I would continue to grow in wisdom so
that I may truly feast on Your Word...Instill in me a
greater love for You and Your Word...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore let us leave the elementary teachings about Christ and go on to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God, instruction about baptism, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment. (Hebrews 6:1, 2) NIV
reflection: Certain basic teachings are essential for all believers to understand. Those basics include: The importance of faith, The foolishness of trying to be saved by good deeds, The meaning of baptism and the spiritual gifts, And the facts of the resurrection and eternal life. To go on to maturity in our understanding, we need to move beyond (but not away from) the basic teachings to a more complete understanding of the faith. Mature Christians should be teaching new Christians the basics. Then, acting on what they know, the mature will learn even more from God's Word.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for the gift of faith, but I pray for a greater sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit's teaching so that I may grow in wisdom enabling me to have a great understanding of Your will. Bless my friends with good health and safety. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~If a relationship has to be secret, you shouldn't be in it...

Our Meditation for Today:

Therefore let us leave the elementary teachings about Christ 
and go on to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God,

instruction about baptism, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment...(Heb. 6:1, 2) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Certain basic teachings are essential for all believers to understand.
Those basics include:
The importance of faith, 
The foolishness of trying to be saved by good deeds, 
The meaning of baptism and the spiritual gifts, 
And the facts of the resurrection and eternal life...

To go on to maturity in our understanding, we need to move beyond
(but not away from) the basic teachings to a more complete understanding
of the faith...

Mature Christians should be teaching new Christians the basics. Then,
acting on what they know, the mature will learn even more from God's
Word...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank you for the gift of faith, but I pray for
a greater sensitivity to Your Holy Spirit's teaching so that
I may grow in wisdom enabling me to have a great understanding of Your will...Bless my e-mail friends with 
good health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened, Who have tasted the heavenly gift, Who have shared in the Holy Spirit, Who have tasted the goodness of the Word of God and the powers of the coming age, If they fall away, to be brought back to repentance. Because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting Him to public disgrace. (Hebrews 6:4-6) NIV
reflection: These verses point out the danger of the Hebrew Christians' returning to Judaism and thus committing apostasy. Some today apply this text to unbelievers who renounce their Christianity, or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and then turn away. Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died once for all. He will not be crucified again, Apart from His cross, there is no possible way of salvation. The author of this text is warning against the hardness of the heart that will make repentance inconceivable for the sinner.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the gift of eternal life which is mine by faith in the finished work of Your Son or Lord Jesus Christ. I pray that the Holy Spirit would be able to soften the hearts of those who have not accepted Christ as Savior. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Everything can change in the blink of an eye.
But don't worry; God never blinks...

Our Meditation for Today:

It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened,
Who have tasted the heavenly gift,
Who have shared in the Holy Spirit,

Who have tasted the goodness of the Word of God
and the powers of the coming age,

If they fall away, to be brought back to repentance.
Because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God
all over again and subjecting Him to public disgrace......(Heb. 6:4-6) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

These verses point out the danger of the Hebrew Christians'
returning to Judaism and thus committing apostasy...

Some today apply this text to unbelievers who renounce their
Christianity, or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and
then turn away...

Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died 
once for all. He will not be crucified again, Apart from His cross, 
there is no possible way of salvation...

The author of this text is warning against the hardness of the heart
that will make repentance inconceivable for the sinner...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the gift of eternal life
which is mine by faith in the finished work of Your Son or Lord
Jesus Christ...I pray that the Holy Spirit would be able to soften 
the hearts of those who have not accepted Christ as Savior...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If they fall away to be brought back to repentance, because to their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting Him to public disgrace. (Hebrews 6:6) NIV
reflection: This verse points to the danger of the Hebrew Christians' returning to Judaism and so committing apostasy. There are those who apply this verse to superficial believers who renounce their Christianity or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and the turn away. Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died once for all. He will not be crucified again. Apart from His cross, there is no other possible way of salvation. The author is warning against the hardness of heart that would make repentance inconceivable for the sinner.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for another new day. I thank You for the one sure way to inherit eternal life. I thank You for Your grace and mercy. I pray that You would enlighten my heart, that I may not sin against You. I pray for good health and safety for all my e-mail friends. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Life is too short for long pity parties.
So get busy living, or get busy dying...

Our Meditation for Today:

If they fall away to be brought back to repentance,
because to their loss they are crucifying the Son
of God all over again and subjecting Him to public 
disgrace...(Heb. 6:6) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

This verse points to the danger of the Hebrew Christians' returning to
Judaism and so committing apostasy...

There are those who apply this verse to superficial believers who renounce
their Christianity or to unbelievers who come close to salvation and the turn
away...

Either way, those who reject Christ will not be saved. Christ died once for all.
He will not be crucified again. Apart from His cross, there is no other possible
way of salvation...

The author is warning against the hardness of heart that would make repentance 
inconceivable for the sinner...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for another new day. 
I thank You for the one sure way to inherit eternal life.
I thank You for Your grace and mercy. I pray that You
would enlighten my heart, that I may not sin against You.
I pray for good health and safety for all my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing of God. But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned. (Hebrews 6:7, 8) NIV
reflection: Land that produces a good crop receives loving care, but land that produces thistles and thorns has to be burned so the farmer can start over. An unproductive Christian life falls under God's condemnation. We are not saved by our deeds or conduct, but what we do is the evidence of our faith.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I come to you seeking sensitivity and obedience that I would live a life of Christ-like love and obedience. I pray for a loving relationship with You and all other believers. Bless my friends again today with good health and the strength to live another day. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~You can get through anything if you stay put in today.

Our Meditation for Today:

Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces 
a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing 
of God...

But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in 
danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned...(Heb. 6:7, 8) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Land that produces a good crop receives loving care, but land that
produces thistles and thorns has to be burned so the farmer can start 
over...

An unproductive Christian life falls under God's condemnation...

We are not saved by our deeds or conduct, but what we do is
the evidence of our faith...


Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I come to you seeking sensitivity and
obedience that I would live a life of Christ-like love and obedience...
I pray for a loving relationship with You and all other believers...
Bless my e-mail friends again today with good health and the 
strength to live another day...

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: God is not unjust; He will not forget your work and the love you have shown Him as you have helped His people and continue to help them. (Hebrews 6:10) NIV
reflection: It is easy to get discouraged, thinking that God has forgotten us. But God is never unjust. He never forgets or overlooks our hard work for Him. Presently you may not be receiving rewards and acclaim, but God knows your efforts of love and ministry. Let God's love for you and His intimate knowledge of your service for Him bolster you as you face disappointment and rejection here on earth.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, the creator and sustained of all that exists. I thank You that You are always there for me during difficult times. I thank You for Your loving kindness, and forgiveness. Place Your protective hand upon each and everyone of my e-mail friends. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~It's never too late to have a happy childhood.
But the second one is up to you and no one else.

Our Meditation for Today:

God is not unjust; He will not forget your work and the love
you have shown Him as you have helped His people and
continue to help them...(Heb. 6:10) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

But God is never unjust. He never forgets or overlooks our hard
work for Him...

Presently you may not be receiving rewards and acclaim, but 
God knows your efforts of love and ministry...

Let God's love for you and His intimate knowledge of your service
for Him bolster you as you face disappointment and rejection here
on earth...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, the creator and sustainer of all that exists.
I thank You that You are always there for me during difficult times.
I thank You for Your loving kindness, and forgiveness...Place Your

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We want each of you to show the same diligence to the very end, in order to make your hope sure. We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised. (Hebrews 6:11, 12) NIV
reflection: Hope keeps the Christian from becoming lazy or feeling bored. Like an athlete, train hard and run well, remembering the reward that lies ahead. Remember Philippians 3:14, I press on toward the goal to win the prize for which God has called me heavenward in Christ Jesus.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for continued strength and faithfulness in order that I may one day receive the prize You have prepared for me. Continue to bless and strengthen my e-mail friends I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Burn the candles, use the nice sheets, wear the fancy lingerie.
Don't save it for a special occasion. Today is special.

in order to make your hope sure...

We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who
through faith and patience inherit what has been promised...(Heb. 6:11, 12) NIV

Our Prayer for Today:

me. Continue to bless and strengthen my e-mail friends I pray in
Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather...

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When God made His promise to Abraham, since there was no one greater for Him to swear by, He swore by Himself, Saying "I will surely bless you and give you many descendants." And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised. (Hebrews 6:13-15) NIV
reflection: Abraham was very patient; it was 25 years from the time God had promised him a son (Genesis 7; 13:14-16; 15:4, 5; 17:16) to Isaac's birth (Genesis 21:1-3). Because our trials and temptations are often so intense. they seem to last for an eternity. Both the Bible and the testimony of mature Christians encourage us to wait for God to act in His timing, even when our needs seem too great to wait any longer.
prayer: So let us take time today to pray for patience, because God knows what is best for us. Keep looking up with an attitude of gratitude. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Over prepare, then go with the flow...

Our Meditation for Today:

When God made His promise to Abraham, since there was no one
greater for Him to swear by, He swore by Himself,

Saying "I will surely bless you and give you many descendents."

And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised...(Heb. 6:13-15) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Abraham was very patient; it was 25 years from the time God had promised
him a son (Gen. 7; 13:14-16; 15:4, 5; 17:16) to Isaac's birth (Gen. 21:1-3)...

Because our trials and temptations are often so intense. they seem to last for an
eternity.

Both the Bible and the testimony of mature Christians encourage us to wait for God 
to act in His timing, even when our needs seem too great to wait any longer...

So let us take time today to pray for patience, 
because God knows what is best for us...

Keep looking up with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of His purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised, He confirmed it with an oath. God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope offered to us may be greatly encouraged. (Hebrews 6:17, 18) NIV
reflection: These two unchangeable things mentioned here are God's promise and His oath. God embodies all truth; so, He cannot lie. Because God is truth, you can be secure in His promise; you don't need to wonder if He will change His plans. Our hope is secure and immovable, anchored in God, just as a ship's anchor holds firmly to the seabed. To the true seeker who comes to God in belief, God gives an unconditional promise of acceptance. When you ask God with openness, honestly, and sincerity to save you from your sins He will do it. This truth should give you encouragement, assurance, and confidence.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the assurance that You are a Just and Holy God. I thank You for this encouraging thought. I thank You for the promise that You do forgive me of my sins. So once again Lord, I come before You seeking forgiveness for all the sins I have committed. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Be eccentric now. Don't wait for old age to wear purple.

Our Meditation for Today:

Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of 
His purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised,
He confirmed it with an oath...

God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which
it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold
of the hope offered to us may be greatly encouraged...(Heb. 6:17, 18) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

These two unchangeable things mentioned here are God's promise and 
His oath. God embodies all truth; so, He cannot lie. Because God is truth, 
you can be secure in His promise; you don't need to wonder if He will
change His plans...

Our hope is secure and immovable, anchored in God, just as a ship's
anchor holds firmly to the seabed...

To the true seeker who comes to God in belief, God gives an unconditional
promise of acceptance. When you ask God with openness, honestly, and 
sincerity to save you from your sins He will do it...

This truth should give you encouragement, assurance, and confidence...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the assurance that You
are a Just and Holy God. I thank You for this encouraging thought.
I thank You for the promise that You do forgive me of my sins.
So once again Lord, I come before You seeking forgiveness for 
all the sins I have committed...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure. It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain, where Jesus, who went before us, has entered on our behalf. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek. (Hebrews 6:19, 20) NIV
reflection: A curtain hung across the entrance from the Holy Place to the Most Holy Place, the two innermost rooms of the Temple. This curtain prevented anyone from entering, gazing into, or even getting a fleeting glimpse of the interior of the Most Holy Place. The high priest could enter there only once a year to stand in God's presence and atone for the sins of the entire nation. But Christ is in God's presence at all times, not just once a year, as the High Priest who can continually intercede for us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for that "Old Rugged Cross" which fulfilled all righteousness, clearing the path to eternal life. I pray that the preaching of the cross and Christ's redeeming blood would once again be the main message of every Christian Church. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~No one is in charge of your happiness except you...

Our Meditation for Today:

We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure.
It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain,

where Jesus, who went before us, has entered on our behalf.
He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek...(Heb. 6:19, 20) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

A curtain hung across the entrance from the Holy Place to the
Most Holy Place, the two innermost rooms of the Temple...

This curtain prevented anyone from entering, gazing into, or even
getting a fleeting glimpse of the interior of the Most Holy Place...

The high priest could enter there only once a year to stand in God's 
presence and atone for the sins of the entire nation...

But Christ is in God's presence at all times, not just once a year, 
as the High Priest who can continually intercede for us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for that "Old Rugged Cross"
which fulfilled all righteousness, clearing the path to eternal life.
I pray that the preaching of the cross and Christ's redeeming blood
would once again be the main message of every Christian Church...Amen

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For when there is a change of the priesthood, there must also be a change of the law. He of whom these things are said belong to a different tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the altar. For it is clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and in regard to that tribe Moses said nothing about priests. (Hebrews 7:12-14) NIV
reflection: Jesus' high-priestly role was superior to that of any priest of Levi, because the Messiah was a priest of a higher order (Psalm 110:4). If the Jewish priests and their laws had been able to save people, why would God need to send Christ as a priest, who came not from the tribe of Levi (the priestly tribe) but from the tribe of Juda? The animal sacrifices had to be repeated, and they offered only temporary forgiveness; but Christ's sacrifice was offered once, and it offers total and permanent forgiveness. Under the new covenant, the levitical priesthood was canceled in favor of Christ's role as High Priest. Because Christ is our High Priest, we need to pay attention to Him. No minister, no leader, or Christian friend can substitute for Christ's work and for His role in our Salvation.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the Gift of eternal life, that is mine because of Christ's shed blood on the cross. I thank You for the fact that His sacrifice is once, and for all. I thank You for the cleansing power of that precious blood. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Frame every so-called disaster with these words: 
"In five years, will this matter?"

Our Meditation for Today:

For when there is a change of the priesthood, there 
must also be a change of the law...

He of whom these things are said belong to a different
tribe, and no one from that tribe has ever served at the
altar...

For it is clear that our Lord descended from Judah, and 
in regard to that tribe Moses said nothing about priests...
(Heb. 7:12-14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus' high-priestly role was superior to that of any priest of Levi,
because the Messiah was a priest of a higher order (Ps. 110:4)...

If the Jewish priests and their laws had been able to save people,
why would God need to send Christ as a priest, who came not from
the tribe of Levi (the priestly tribe) but from the tribe of Juda?

The animal sacrifices had to be repeated, and they offered only
temporary forgiveness; but Christ's sacrifice was offered once, 
and it offers total and permanent forgiveness...

Under the new covenant, the levitical priesthood was canceled in
favor of Christ's role as High Priest...

Because Christ is our High Priest, we need to pay attention to Him.
No minister, no leader, or Christian friend can substitute for Christ's
work and for His role in our Salvation...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the Gift of eternal
life, that is mine because of Christ's shed blood on the 
cross...I thank You for the fact that His sacrifice is once,
and for all...I thank You for the cleansing power of that 
precious blood...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The former regulation is set aside because it was weak and useless. (for the law made nothing perfect), and a better hope is introduced, by which we draw near to God. (Hebrews 7:18, 19) NIV
reflection: The law was never meant to save people, but to point out sin (Romans 3:20; 5:20) and to point toward Christ (as we see by Galatians 3:24, 25). Salvation comes through Christ, whose sacrifice brings forgiveness of our sins. Being ethical, working diligently to help others, and giving to charitable causes are all commendable, but all of our good deeds cannot save us or make us right with God. There is a "better hope."
prayer: Most Gracious Heavenly Father, by Your grace we can inherit eternal life for which I am eternally thankful. May Your grace flow freely and bring to repentance those who are searching. Bless all my e-mail friends today with the peace that passeth all understanding. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Always choose life...

Our Meditation for Today:

The former regulation is set aside because it was weak
and useless...

(for the law made nothing perfect), and a better hope is 
introduced, by which we draw near to God...(Heb. 7:18, 19) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The law was never meant to save people, but to point out sin (Ro. 3:20; 5:20)
and to point toward Christ (as we see by Gal. 3:24, 25). Salvation comes
through Christ, whose sacrifice brings forgiveness of our sins...

Being ethical, working diligently to help others, and giving to charitable causes 
are all commendable, but all of our good deeds cannot save us or make us 
right with God. There is a "better hope."

Our Prayer for Today:
Most Gracious Heavenly Father, by Your grace we can
inherit eternal life for which I am eternally thankful. May
Your grace flow freely and bring to repentance those who
are searching...Bless all my e-mail friends today with the
peace that passeth all understanding...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Because of His oath, Jesus has become the guarantee of a better covenant. Now there have been many of those priests, since death prevented them from continuing in office; but because Jesus lives forever, He has a permanent priesthood. (Hebrews 7:22-24) NIV
reflection: Now this "better covenant" is also called the new covenant or testament. It is new and better because it allows us to go directly to God through Christ. We no longer need to rely on sacrificed animals and mediating priests to obtain God's forgiveness. This new covenant is better because, while all human priests die, Christ lives forever. Priests and sacrifices could not save people, but Christ truly saves. You have access to Christ. He is available to you, but do you go to Him with your needs?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the assurance of a better covenant. I thank You that through Your Son our Lord Jesus Christ, we can come to You at any time and you will hear our prayers. I thank You that there is no longer any need for a sacrifice. My request today is for good health, healing, and grace for each of my friends. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Forgive as God forgives you...

Our Meditation for Today:

Because of His oath, Jesus has become the guarantee 
of a better covenant...

Now there have been many of those priests, since death
prevented them from continuing in office;

but because Jesus lives forever, He has a permanent 
priesthood...(Heb. 7:22-24) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Now this "better covenant" is also called the new covenant
or testament. It is new and better because it allows us to go
directly to God through Christ...

We no longer need to rely on sacrificed animals and mediating
priests to obtain God's forgiveness. This new covenant is better 
because, while all human priests die, Christ lives forever...

Priests and sacrifices could not save people, but Christ truly saves.
You have access to Christ. He is available to you, but do you go to 
Him with your needs?

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the assurance of a
better covenant. I thank You that through Your Son our Lord
Jesus Christ, we can come to You at any time and you will 
hear our prayers. I thank You that there is no longer any need 
for a sacrifice... My request today is for good health, healing, 
and grace for each of my e-mail friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore He is able to save completely those who come to God through Him, because He always lives to intercede for them. (Hebrews 7:25) NIV
reflection: No one can add to what Jesus did to save us; our past, present, and future sins are all forgiven, and Jesus is with the Father as a sign that our sins are forgiven. If you are a believing Christian, remember Christ has paid the price for your sins once and for all (see Hebrews 9:24-28). Christ makes perpetual intercession before God for us. Christ's continuous presence in heaven with the Father assures us that our sins have been paid for and forgiven (see Romans 8:33, 34; Hebrews 2:17, 18; 4:15, 16; 9:24). This wonderful assurance frees us from guilt and from fear of failure.
prayer: Thank You Lord, for the assurance of salvation. Thank Your love and willingness to go the way of the cross in my place. Thank you for the freedom from the guilt, and the fear of failure that Satan would attempt to lay on me. Help me to become a better witness each day. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~What other people think of you is none of your business...

Our Meditation for Today:

Therefore He is able to save completely those who come to God
through Him, because He always lives to intercede for them...(Heb.7:25) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

No one can add to what Jesus did to save us; our past, present,
and future sins are all forgiven, and Jesus is with the Father as a
sign that our sins are forgiven...

If you are a believing Christian, remember Christ has paid the 
price for your sins once and for all (see Heb. 9:24-28).

Christ makes perpetual intercession before God for us. Christ's
continuous presence in heaven with the Father assures us that
our sins have been paid for and forgiven (see Ro. 8:33, 34;
Heb. 2:17, 18; 4:15, 16; 9:24)...

This wonderful assurance frees us from guilt and from fear of failure...

Our Prayer for Today:
Thank You Lord, for the assurance of salvation. Thank Your
love and willingness to go the way of the cross in my place...
Thank you for the freedom from the guilt, and the fear of failure
that Satan would attempt to lay on me...Help me to become a 
better witness each day...Amen.

Keep looking up with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Unlike other high priests, He (Jesus) does not need to offer sacrifices day after day, first for His own sins, and then for the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for all when He offered Himself. (Hebrews 7:27) NIV
reflection: Because Jesus did die once for all, He brought the sacrificial system to an end. He forgave sins, past, present, and future. The Jews did not need to go back to the old system because Christ, the perfect sacrifice, completed the work of redemption. You don't have to look for another way to have your sins forgiven, Christ was, and still is the final sacrifice for you.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the ultimate sacrifice, that You made for my sins. I thank You for being my mediator, that You stand ready to defend me before our Heavenly Father. I pray that You would protect my e-mail friends with a hedge of thorns from the evil one. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Time heals almost everything...Give time time...

Unlike other high priests, He (Jesus) does not need to offer 
sacrifices day after day, first for His own sins, and then for
the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for 
all when He offered Himself...(Heb. 7:27) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Because Jesus did die once for all, He brought the sacrificial
system to an end. He forgave sins, past, present, and future...

The Jews did not need to go back to the old system because 
Christ, the perfect sacrifice, completed the work of redemption...

You don't have to look for another way to have your sins forgiven,
Christ was, and still is the final sacrifice for you...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the ultimate sacrifice,
that You made for my sins. I thank You for being my mediator,

I pray that You would protect my e-mail friends with a hedge

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For the law appoints as high priests men who are weak; but the oath, which came after the law, appointed the Son, who has been made perfect forever. (Hebrews 7:28)
reflection: As we come to understand the Jewish sacrificial system better, we will see that Jesus death served as a perfect atonement for our sins. His death brings us eternal life. How callous, how cold, how stubborn it would be to refuse God's greatest gift.
prayer: Dear Lord, the words that best explain my feeling for the wonderful gift of salvation is, "heaven came down and glory filled my soul---when at the cross the Savior made me whole. My prayer is that all stubbornness in the world would be left at the cross so that every sin would be washed away. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~However good or bad a situation is, it will change...

Our Meditation for Today:

For the law appoints as high priests men who are weak; 
but the oath, which came after the law, appointed the
Son, who has been made perfect forever...Heb. 7:28) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

As we come to understand the Jewish sacrificial system better,
we will see that Jesus death served as a perfect atonement for
our sins...

His death brings us eternal life. How callous, how cold, how
stubborn it would be to refuse God's greatest gift...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, the words that best explain my feeling for the

My prayer is that all stubbornness in the world would be left at

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: This is the covenant I will make with the house of Israel after that time, declares the Lord. I will put My laws in their minds and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be My people. (Hebrews 8:10) NIV
reflection: If our heart is not changed, following God's rules will be unpleasant and difficult. We will rebel against being told how to live. The Holy Spirit, however, gives us new desires, helping us want to obey God (check out Philippians 2:12, 13). With a new heart, we find that serving God is the greatest joy.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, my prayer is that more and more people would develop loving hearts and come to realize the joy of serving You. May they develop a desire to truly obey Your laws. Bless and protect each of my e-mail friends today. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Your job won't take care of you when you are sick.
Your friends will. Stay in touch...

that time, declares the Lord. I will put My laws in their minds
and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they 
will be My people...(Heb. 8:10) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

If our heart is not changed, following God's rules will be unpleasant
and difficult. We will rebel against being told how to live...

The Holy Spirit, however, gives us new desires, helping us want to
obey God (check out Phil. 2:12, 13). With a new heart, we find that
serving God is the greatest joy...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, my prayer is that more and more

the joy of serving You. May they develop a desire to

friends today...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: No longer will a man teach his neighbor, or a man his brother, saying know the Lord, because they will all know me, from the least of them to the greatest. (Hebrews 8:11) NIV
reflection: Under God's new covenant, God's law is inside us. It is no longer an external set of rules and principles. The Holy Spirit reminds us of Christ's words, activates our conscience, influences our motives and desires, and makes us want to obey. Now doing God's will is something we desire with all our heart and mind.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the work of Your Holy Spirit, activating my conscience which influences my thoughts and actions. I thank You for His leading and guiding leading me to do God's will day by day. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Believe in miracles...

know me, from the least of them to the greatest...(Heb. 8:11) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Under God's new covenant, God's law is inside us. It is no longer
an external set of rules and principles...

The Holy Spirit reminds us of Christ's words, activates our conscience,
influences our motives and desires, and makes us want to obey...

Now doing God's will is something we desire with all our heart and mind...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the work of Your Holy Spirit,
activating my conscience which influences my thoughts and actions.
I thank You for His leading and guiding leading me to do God's will
day by day...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves; but He entered the Most Holy Place once for all by His own blood, having obtained eternal redemption. (Hebrews 9:12) NIV
reflection: Though you know Christ, you may believe that you have to work hard to make yourself good enough for God. But rules and rituals have never cleansed people's hearts. By Jesus' blood alone (1) We have our conscience cleansed, (2) We are freed from death's sting and can live to serve God, and (3) We are freed from sin's power. If you are carrying a load of guilt because you are finding that you can't be good enough for God, take another look at Jesus' death and what it means to you. Christ can heal your conscience and deliver you from the frustration of trying to earn God's favor.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for what Christ's shed blood means in my life. I thank You for removing the guilt of my sins. I thank You for the healing power that comes from Christ, since Christ came into my life. Amen.
original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Whatever doesn't kill you really does make you stronger...

Our Meditation for Today:

He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves;
but He entered the Most Holy Place once for all by His own
blood, having obtained eternal redemption...(Heb. 9:12) NIV

Our Thought for Today:


Though you know Christ, you may believe that you have to work 
hard to make yourself good enough for God. But rules and rituals
have never cleansed people's hearts...

By Jesus' blood alone (1) We have our conscience cleansed,
(2) We are freed from death's sting and can live to serve God,
and (3) We are freed from sin's power...

If you are carrying a load of guilt because you are finding that
you can't be good enough for God, take another look at Jesus'
death and what it means to you...

Christ can heal your conscience and deliver you from the frustration 
of trying to earn God's favor...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for what Christ's shed blood
means in my life...I thank You for removing the guilt of my sins...
I thank You for the healing power that comes from Christ, since
Christ came into my life...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled on those who are ceremonially unclean sanctify them so they are outwardly clean. How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered Himself unblemished to God, cleanse our conscience from acts that lead to death, so that we may serve the living God. (Hebrews 9:13, 14) NIV
reflection: When the people sacrificed animals, God considered the people's faith and obedience, cleansed them from sin, and made them ceremonially acceptable according to the Old Testament law. But Christ's sacrifice transforms our life and heart and makes us clean on the inside. His sacrifice was infinitely more effective than animal sacrifices. No barrier of sin or weakness on our part can stifle His forgiveness.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the cleansing power of the blood of Jesus Christ. I thank You for the plan of salvation that was made available through the death of Your Son Jesus Christ. Accept my plea for the forgiveness of my many sins. Amen.
original_content:
This is the day the Lord has made!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Growing old beats the alternative--dying young...

Our Meditation for Today:

The blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkled
on those who are ceremonially unclean sanctify them so they are
outwardly clean...

How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the 
eternal Spirit offered Himself unblemished to God, cleanse our 
conscience from acts that lead to death, so that we may serve
the living God...(Heb. 9:13, 14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

When the people sacrificed animals, God considered the people's faith 
and obedience, cleansed them from sin, and made them ceremonially
acceptable according to the Old Testament law...

But Christ's sacrifice transforms our life and heart and makes us clean on 
the inside. His sacrifice was infinitely more effective than animal sacrifices.
No barrier of sin or weakness on our part can stifle His forgiveness...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the cleansing power of 
the blood of Jesus Christ. I thank You for the plan of salvation
that was made available through the death of Your Son Jesus 
Christ. Accept my plea for the forgiveness of my many sins...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
